WizardAnswered on 05 Jun 2019I sometimes do a OMAD (One Meal a Day) challenge - it's awesome because even if I have a $10 dinner inclusive of drinks, my daily meal expense is $10!Of course it doesn't make sense to overdo it - you could lose alot of weight doing this while working out, but it could wreak havoc on your hormornes and general health if you are constantly eating very little.0 comments1

3. Spend less than $50 on dating/entertainment per week. You will realise there are alot of free things to do in singapore

See all 3 comments Michelle Ho22 Nov 2018I ever spend $30-$40/week for food. That's for cooking at home, meal prep 3 meals plus snacks. That's $120-$160/month. If eat outside, $3.50 cai fan plus $1.50 drink=$5.00/meal. 2 meals outside plus 1 breakfast at home ( usually bread = $2.10+$4.50(spread)) that's bout $10+/day. Times 30 days will be about $300-$350/month. Electricity and gas didn't shoot up during that month. So utility bills was normal.
